page.title: 02Local History In New Milton
page.content: Our area has been inhabited since the {Old-Stone-Age}about 10,000 years ago. Some flint hand-tools were found in the gravel pits just beyond the far end of our school field and in the school drive. Polished flints were found at{Golden Hill}dating from the{ {New-Stone_Age}(4000-2000 BC). Burial urns half a metre tall dating from the {Bronze-Age}(1000-500 BC) were found. Five local places were mentioned in the{Domesday Book}of 1086. Their place name derivations are as follows: { Ashley.}This means{Ash wood. { Milton.}This means{Middle Farm.}A ton is an{enclosed farm. { Barton.}It was{Beorma's Farm.} { Fernhill.}It was a{hill covered in {ferns. { Hordle.}It was a{hoard (treasure) {hill. }
